subject: Programming
title: Computational Thinking
description: A short lesson to help you apply Computational Thinking.

hook.text: Computational thinking isn't about computers. It's about breaking any problem into solvable steps.

buildup.text: Decompose the problem. Find patterns. Abstract the details. Design the algorithm. Four core steps.

discovery.text: Doctors diagnosing patients and chefs following recipes use computational thinking without knowing it.

twist.text: Schools now teach computational thinking to children. It's becoming as fundamental as reading and writing.

climax.text: Programming teaches this mindset as a side effect. The skill transfers to every domain of life.

punchline.text: Think like a programmer, even away from code.

quiz.question: What are the four steps of computational thinking?
options: Decompose, find patterns, abstract, design algorithm
